_exec_summary.SummaryText:
ty measures:
Fence with barbed wire surrounding the site
Security camera(s) in selected areas
Main entrance staffed with guards on a 24 hour basis.
All other gates are either locked or guarded but may be opened in the event of emergency egress.
Warning signs

It is the policy of Energy Harbor to assure the safe operation of the facility which is designed and built to good engineering practices that incorporate methods or principles in accordance with applicable industry standards.  

Accident History
There have been no reportable accidents.  

Emergency Response
There is a written emergency response plan that is coordinated with the Jefferson County LEPC and the local fire departments.  Selected site response personnel are Hazwoper trained.    

Emergency response planning has long been an integral part of operations at Sammis.  Regulations under OSHA, EPA, Coast Guard, and Ohio EPA have required the site to develop and implement procedures to plan for and respond to emergency situations at the plant whether due to natural disasters, storms, exposure to releases or harm/damage resulting from potentially flammable or explosive materials.  

Planned Changes to Improve Safety
In response to the 5 year RMP review and revalidation, the following action items are planned to be conducted by Energy Harbor.
Node Aqueous Ammonia Storage - PRV's should be inspected and tested in accordance with
guidelines set forth in B31.3.
Node Truck Unloading Station (Emergency Scenarios) - Provide portable Secondary Containment
for Truck unloading during process.
Emergency Response Plan - Emergency Response Plan will be updated to reflect current contact
information of plant staff.

 
Description of Release Scenarios

Worst Case Release Scenarios
#1.  Aqueous Ammonia Storage Unloading Station - Urban - 57,000 gallons
#2.  Aqueous Ammonia Storage Unloading Station - Rural - 57,000 gallons
#3.  Emergency Truck Unloading Feed Station - Urban - 6,000 gallons

Alternative Release Scenarios
#1.  Aqueous Ammonia Storage Unloading Station - Urban - 500 gallons
#2.  Emergency Truck Unloading Feed Station - Urban - 500 gallons
